version_description:
- 10 Pin Shuffle is now iOS 8 and iPhone 6 compliant!
- Minor bug fixes

1) Frame rate has increased to a silky smooth 60fps on newer devices (iPhone 4s, iPad 2, iPod touch 5th gen and newer).
2) Scores and statistics are now synchronized between all your devices using the iCloud.
3) Changed the appearance of the standard white iOS 7+ message boxes.
4) iOS 9 compatible.

If you've reviewed or rated a previous version of 10 Pin Shuffle then please take a few seconds to re-send it as ratings are reset with each new update. You won't need to re-write your review, you just need to rate this new version and press the send button again on the App Store review page. Thanks!

1) Removed Apple's iAd banners in anticipation of them closing down the service at the end of June.
2) Added high definition retina images to all the "How to Play" and "Game Controls" help pages.
3) Minor bug fixes.

1) If you don't want to buy the Pro version then you can now play games of Shuffleboard, Traditional 10 Pin Bowling and Peer-to-Peer multiplayer matches by watching a short video ad.
2) Bowling replays are now in slow motion.
3) The frame of the shuffleboard table frame is shinier.
4) The sound of the puck being dragged around the table would sometimes crackle. This has been fixed.

1) Added "Gold Shuffleboard Puck" awards that you can earn by watching videos or recommending the game to friends via text message or e-mail. You can use the Gold Shuffleboard Pucks to play features that are usually only available in the Pro version such as Shuffleboard, traditional 10 Pin Bowling or Peer-to-Peer multiplayer games.
2) Added a Share button so you can easily tell friends about 10 Pin Shuffle via text message or e-mail. Please help us out and spread the word! You can remove the button from the Settings screen if it annoys you.

Bug Fixes in v2.10

1) Now fills the entire screen on the iPhone X.
2) You can tap the screen to skip replays and Strike/Spare/Turkey animations.
3) Added a volume slider to the Pause screen so you can change the sound effects volume while playing a game.
4) New look to the bowling pins with gold base and new artwork.
5) Smoother game frame rate.

2) The sound effects volume may have always been set to the maximum each time the App launched.
3) The opponents that you'd unlocked on one device weren't synchronizing with your other devices via the iCloud.

1) All devices display in their native screen resolution now. This mainly affects the larger screen iPhone Plus devices.
2) You can now choose whether you shoot first or second against a Bowling CPU opponent.
3) Compliance with iOS 14 Ad Tracking Transparency where consent is required to display personalized ads.

Bug Fixes in 2.31

1) Sometimes the game would crash when the cards were shown at the end of a game of Poker.
2) If you scored a Strike in Poker with 4 cards showing and then tapped on the empty space where the 5th card should be then the game would crash.
3) If you put the app into the background during game play and then opened the app again then the screen wouldn’t update.
4) The in-game store where you acquire gold shuffleboard pucks would crash when the language was set to Japanese.
5) There was a visible glitch at the end of each player’s turn during a Peer-to-Peer multiplayer game.
The puck wouldn't swipe properly on some devices.

1) The game would freeze and not accept input on iPhone 12, 13 and newer iPads when running iOS 15.
2) Buttons and other UI now correctly positioned on all iPads (the main culprits were 12.9 inch iPads, latest iPad Air and other non standard pixel sized iPads.
3) Dark mode made certain screens look bad so the backgrounds are now always white instead of black.
